Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery oinochoe; interior reserved with wheelmarks; exterior, cream slip; part of two friezes preserved separated by broad band with added white and red bands; above, part of two goats grazing to left; filling ornament: rosettes; purple patch on shoulder of goat; slight remains in lower frieze.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Possibly by the same hand as G119.27 (AshmLoan714).
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.606)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.14)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
